Jail Wedding at Todd Road Jail

We coordinate the entire jail wedding process at Todd Road Jail — from the initial marriage request and notary visit to the ceremony and marriage license filing.

Located on a 157-acre campus in Santa Paula, Todd Road is the largest modern housing facility in the Ventura County jail system and was built to relieve overcrowding at the downtown Main Jail.

Facility Details

What to Expect at Todd Road Jail

Every facility handles inmate marriages differently. Here's what you need to know about getting married at Todd Road Jail.

Approval process: Marriage requests are submitted through the Ventura County Sheriff's Office. Approval typically takes 2 to 4 weeks depending on classification and housing status.
Ceremony setting: Ceremonies take place during regular visiting hours in the visiting area. There is no private chapel or dedicated ceremony room.
Guest policy: Ventura County allows up to two visitors per visit — two adults, or one adult and one minor. One visitor must serve as your witness, and all visitors must present valid government-issued photo ID.
Visiting hours: Most inmates receive two 30-minute visits per week on Wednesday, Thursday, Saturday, and Sunday. Visitors must check in one hour before the posted visiting time for their housing unit.
Items allowed: Only keys and ID. No phones, purses, bags, cameras, food, drink, or gifts. No items — including rings — may be exchanged with the inmate.
Good to know: Todd Road sits on a large 157-acre campus outside Santa Paula and was purpose-built with roughly 796 beds. The facility often operates above rated capacity, so visiting-day parking and processing can be busy. The campus is rural — plan to gas up before you head out, especially if driving from LA via the 126.

Getting There & Check‑In

Visiting Todd Road Jail for a Wedding

Todd Road Jail is located on South Todd Road in Santa Paula, roughly 15 minutes north of the 101 via the 126 freeway. The facility is in a rural area — budget extra time and fuel.

Directions & Parking

  • Address: 600 S Todd Rd, Santa Paula, CA 93060.
  • From the 101: Take the 126 east toward Santa Paula / Fillmore. Exit Todd Road and head south. The facility entrance is on the right.
  • From LA / San Fernando Valley: Take the 101 north to the 126 east. It's roughly 70 miles from downtown LA — about 1 to 1.5 hours without traffic.
  • Parking: Free parking lot on-site. The lot can fill up on weekend visiting days, so arrive early.
  • Rideshare: Uber/Lyft can drop off at the main entrance. Service may be limited in this rural area; plan your return ride in advance.

What to Know Before Check‑In

  • Scheduling: Call the Todd Road visiting line at (805) 933-8501 for visiting times and requirements. Have the inmate's full name and booking number ready.
  • Visit limits: Two 30-minute visits per week, up to two visitors per visit.
  • Arrive early: Check in at least one hour before the posted visiting time. Late arrivals may lose their visit.
  • Dress code: Shirts with sleeves required; no sheer clothing; skirts/shorts no more than one inch above the knee; no midriff, strapless, or low-cut tops; no gang or obscene graphics.
  • Leave in your car: Cell phones, purses, wallets, bags, cameras, food, drink, strollers — everything except keys and your ID.
What the Ceremony Is Like

Your Wedding at Todd Road Jail

Here's what to expect on ceremony day so there are no surprises.

The Visiting Room

  • Ceremonies take place in the regular visiting area — no private chapel or special ceremony room is provided.
  • Visits are 30 minutes; the ceremony is designed to fit within that window comfortably.
  • Visit format (glass or face-to-face) depends on the inmate's housing and classification.
  • Up to two visitors per visit — you and your witness.

Plan Your Day

  • Total time on-site: 2 to 3 hours including parking, security screening, waiting, and the visit itself.
  • No items exchanged: Rings, gifts, letters, or any other items cannot be passed to the inmate.
  • No photography: No cameras, phones, or recording devices are allowed inside the visiting area.
  • After the wedding: We file your signed marriage license with the county recorder. The certified copy arrives by mail within several weeks.
  • Rural location: Pack snacks and water for the drive; there are limited food options near the facility.

Common Questions

Jail Wedding FAQ — Todd Road Jail

How long does a wedding at Todd Road Jail take to arrange?

Typically 2 to 4 weeks from the initial marriage request to the ceremony, depending on approval timelines and visiting availability.

Can the ceremony be on a weekend?

Yes. Todd Road offers visiting on Saturdays and Sundays; we coordinate your ceremony during one of those blocks when possible.

What if my partner is moved to the Main Jail or East Valley?

We cover all Ventura County jails. If the inmate is transferred, we adjust the plan and coordinate with the new facility.

Can we bring a ring to the ceremony?

No. Todd Road Jail does not allow the exchange of any items during visiting or ceremonies.

What if my partner doesn't have ID?

Valid government-issued ID is preferred. If the inmate does not have current ID, contact us — we work through this frequently.

How much does it cost?

We provide a personalized quote after a brief consultation. No hidden mileage, weekend, or after-hours surcharges.
